text:
hello and greetings from buenos aires argentina 
in today's video we're going to be taking you on

a breakfast tour across the city showing you the 
different types of breakfast you can enjoy here

we'll hit up a regular neighborhood coffee shop 
where the pastries are freshly baked and the

coffee mugs are deep we'll also visit a classic 
old world cafe that oozes history and charm

and lastly we'll visit a more contemporary 
cafe with some more savory food options

so with that in mind let's go see what 
we can eat in buenos aires for breakfast

alright guys so day one of our argentine breakfast 
challenge today we're going to kick things off

with just an average local neighborhood coffee 
spot so it's just around the corner we go here all

the time when we're staying in the neighborhood 
of almagro it's a place where you get big cups

of coffee media lunas and it's just like your 
average spot like people who are stopping here are

on their way to work or maybe just coming to read 
the newspaper so yeah very classic local let's go

so we got two different styles of the classic 
argentine breakfast sam got the completo which i

would call the greedy guts breakfast this is gonna 
get a little bit of everything yeah and i went for

more of a traditional cafe in media lunas and my 
favorite thing about this coffee shop is the size

of their coffee cups it's not every restaurant 
that gives you a coffee cup this size this is

almost like a mug they're just huge they're huge i 
feel like i'm getting two coffee cups in one here

oh and it's good coffee good way to start 
the morning and of course i paired it

with the media lunas which are kind of like 
croissants they're very buttery and doughy

fluffy it's almost like biting into a cloud and 
with these ones you can get the salty variety

which is made with lard or you can get the 
sweet variety which has a sugar glaze over top

yeah so you had the classic porteño breakfast 
which is the media lunas and the cafe

i am getting the tostado breakfast yeah and so

and of course the giant cup cafe con leche yes you

know what like your dad said this before but it's 
so true you're gonna get your best cup of coffee

in all of argentina and buenos aires for sure 
there's just such a high standard at the cafes

agreed this is like italian coffee and to come in 
such a large mug this is like exactly what i want

because normally i have two or three cups

so this is almost like two or three cops in

yeah that's the point of size breakfast exactly

that's really good i'm indulging my sweet

and i wanted to show you guys the soda water

we got everything we eat actually that includes

alright guys so today we are taking you out for a

fancy breakfast a little something different from

one of my favorite cafes in all of buenos aires 
this place is called petit colon and it oozes

block away from teatro colon which is the

biggest grandest theater in the whole city so yeah 
we're gonna be taking you for argentine breakfast

we've beaten here many times before and 
we hope you enjoy it as much as i do

so i'm going to start with the croissant the 
medialuna stuffed with ham and cheese what i

really like about this is the combination of like 
sweet and savory you've got the sweetness of the

croissant which has a glaze over top but then the 
savory of the ham and the cheese a really nice

combination even if it seems a bit strange like 
why would you put those two together but i like it

this is very good i highly recommend trying 
it if you find yourself here in buenos aires

it's also known as a mafalda a 
stuffed croissant is a mafalda

so if you see that on the menu 
you know what you're getting

now some crisps it's nice to be having something 
a little salty for breakfast too we have a lot

of sweets most breakfasts are sweet unless you 
order like the ham and cheese grilled sandwich

you can also do that as a breakfast food item but 
here in argentina it's mostly a sweet breakfast

and then for today's drink we wanted to show you 
the submarine it means submarine and basically

it's just a cup of hot milk and they give you 
a piece of chocolate it's from the brand aguila

and then you drop the chocolate into the 
milk like a little submarine you wait

for it to start to melt and then you mix it 
and you get like this sort of hot chocolate

the flavors of my childhood oh and then we had

it's like a vanilla sponge cake with icing sugar

it tastes a little bit like

this is kind of the ultimate

aires it's just it's phenomenal the

what's just over 600 pesos 650 pesos yeah just

we ate really well i'm beyond satisfied and 
yeah if you come to buenos aires another place

worth adding to your list petit colon check it

we're going to be trying different toasts and

in argentina this is more of a modern twist a

contemporary version of it plus we've also ordered

feel like is just ultimate hipster breakfast 
so we've got that coming some tropical juices

a coffee for sam and yeah a different type of 
breakfast that you can enjoy here in buenos aires

breakfast time breakfast 
time so i've got a giant mug

of cafe con leche yes which is always 
a good way to start off the morning

oh it's really good it's got a tangy

nice brown bread this is a really good

that beer is getting out of hand kind of is and

good stuff i got the avocado toast all right 
so this is a really tasty avocado toast we've

got a whole grain bread that has lots of 
seeds and nuts and then we've got like our

guacamole so it's not just avocado i feel like 
this is guacamole like it's got a bit of lemon

juice and some onions there's a little something 
going on there and then we've got like this fluffy

thin omelette that's been folded 
in half put on top of the toast

we've got some alfalfa sprouts and yeah it's just 
really really tasty i'm quite pleased with this

and then on the other hand there's the grilled 
cheese sandwich that we just stretched before your

eyes so you can see how cheesy it really is and 
this grilled ham and cheese sandwich is definitely

more north american style like here 
in argentina it's usually that like

thin spongy bread with like the ham and cheese 
but this is like a much thicker slice of bread

buttered and toasted like on both sides and for 
my drink i got maracuda which is passion fruit

it is a passion fruit juice so it tastes nice 
and tropical and brings back memories of brazil

good breakfast overall yeah that was breakfast 
actually more like a brunch today so it came to

800 pesos which is currently 13 us dollars and 
that included the two juices the three pieces

of toast and the coffee to be honest guys those 
pieces of toast and that sandwich were really

big one would have been enough per person oh yeah 
this is technically enough food for three people

three sandwiches three drinks exactly we basically 
ordered breakfast for three and it came to 13

so a good deal and yeah very tasty here 
i would come back here again for sure

thank you for joining us on this little breakfast 
tour of buenos aires argentina if you enjoyed
